structuralFindings.rationale: Ulta Beauty has established a formal AI Center of Excellence led by CTTO Mike Maresca that brings together AI/ML engineers from across the organization. This central hub sets standards and develops capabilities while distributed teams (Digital Innovation, Supply Chain, Marketing) apply AI to their specific domains. The Virtual Beauty Advisor AI tool shows a hub-and-spoke model where central AI expertise produces customer-facing tools used across channels. Prisma Ventures provides an innovation arm. The orientation is Contextual because AI adoption is being embedded across all functions (associates using AI tools, marketing personalization, supply chain optimization) rather than isolated to a separate exploration unit.
structuralFindings.aiTeamStructure: AI Center of Excellence (central hub) created by CTTO Mike Maresca, pulling together AI/ML engineers from across the organization. Separate Digital Innovation team led by Juan Cardelino (Director of Computer Vision and Digital Innovation) handles consumer-facing AI like GlamLab and Virtual Try-On. Corporate venture arm Prisma Ventures invests in AI startups (Haut.ai, Adeptmind, Iterate.ai). No dedicated Chief AI Officer — AI reports through CTTO Mike Maresca and CDO Prama Bhatt.

keyPeople.name: Kecia Steelman
keyPeople.title: President & CEO
keyPeople.role: Sets AI vision as part of Ulta Beauty Unleashed strategy; speaks publicly about AI personalization and agentic AI

keyPeople.name: Mike Maresca
keyPeople.title: Chief Technology and Transformation Officer
keyPeople.role: Leads AI Center of Excellence; oversees technology modernization (Project SOAR); drives agentic AI adoption

keyPeople.name: Prama Bhatt
keyPeople.title: Chief Digital Officer
keyPeople.role: Leads digital innovation including AI personalization, Quazi decisioning engine, generative AI exploration

keyPeople.name: Juan Cardelino
keyPeople.title: Director of Computer Vision and Digital Innovation
keyPeople.role: Leads consumer-facing AI including GlamLab virtual try-on, skin analysis tools

structuralFindings.investmentSignals: Multi-year SAP modernization (Project SOAR) costing 'tens of millions of dollars' completed 2025. Prisma Ventures corporate venture fund investing in AI startups. 25-30% productivity improvement from AI coding tools (Gemini Code Assist). Leadership stated 2026 'will not be another big heavy investment year' — suggesting heavy investment period 2024-2025. CFO noted 'While these investments create near-term pressure, we expect they will support long-term revenue and market share growth.'

observableMarkers.reportingStructure: AI reports through CTTO (Mike Maresca) and CDO (Prama Bhatt). No dedicated CAIO. Both report to CEO Kecia Steelman.
observableMarkers.resourceAllocation: Dedicated AI Center of Excellence with cross-functional AI/ML engineers. Prisma Ventures for external AI investments. Significant CapEx in technology modernization through Project SOAR.
observableMarkers.timeHorizons: Mixed: Near-term AI deployment (supply chain, payroll tools) + longer-term agentic AI development. CEO: 'There is no finish line in our technology and our investments.'
observableMarkers.decisionRights: Centralized AI capability development (Center of Excellence) with distributed application (each function applies AI tools). Evaluating whether to deploy single unified AI assistant vs. specialized agents.
observableMarkers.metrics: Measuring: IT productivity (25-30% improvement from AI coding tools), e-commerce growth (double-digit for 3 quarters), loyalty members (46.3M), app penetration (65% of online member sales), ship-from-store expansion (1,000+ locations).

quotes.text: Our teams are adapting well to our new ways of working and we are steadily advancing our optimization efforts. During the quarter, we leveraged new AI and machine learning capabilities to drive supply chain efficiencies and launched scheduling and enhanced payroll management tools to optimize our efforts and support our cost saving goals.
quotes.speaker: Kecia Steelman
quotes.context: Discussing AI's impact during fiscal Q1 2025 earnings call

quotes.text: There is no finish line in our technology and our investments.
quotes.speaker: Kecia Steelman
quotes.context: Emphasizing ongoing commitment to technology investments

quotes.text: Our investments to elevate the digital experience and accelerate personalization are really driving both channels up.
quotes.speaker: Kecia Steelman
quotes.context: Discussing digital and AI investments impact on sales

quotes.text: It's not just a strategy, it's a way of being and you can feel it through the entire organization.
quotes.speaker: Kecia Steelman
quotes.context: Discussing Ulta Beauty Unleashed strategy at NRF Big Show keynote

quotes.text: The irony of generative AI is my hope that it actually becomes the most human thing that we do together because it allows people to leverage tools in a way that helps them do what they do even better and drive even more human connection.
quotes.speaker: Prama Bhatt
quotes.context: Discussing philosophy on AI and human connection

quotes.text: The power of agents is really going to come to life next year as part of the Ulta Beauty story.
quotes.speaker: Mike Maresca
quotes.context: Discussing future agentic AI deployment plans

quotes.text: Shoppers need to try out hair and makeup styles before they purchase.
quotes.speaker: Juan Cardelino

summary: Ulta Beauty operates a Hybrid/Hub-and-Spoke model (M4) with a formal AI Center of Excellence led by CTTO Mike Maresca that develops capabilities deployed across business functions. AI adoption is Contextually oriented — embedded throughout operations (supply chain, personalization, associate tools) rather than isolated in an exploration unit. The company has made significant multi-year investments (Project SOAR, Prisma Ventures) and is actively deploying agentic AI for 2026, with CEO Kecia Steelman championing AI as central to their 'Ulta Beauty Unleashed' transformation strategy.
openQuestions: Exact size/headcount of AI Center of Excellence team
Specific budget allocation for AI vs. broader technology investments
Reporting structure details — whether AI CoE reports through CTTO, CDO, or matrix structure
Decision on unified AI assistant vs. specialized agents (noted as under evaluation)
Full scope of Prisma Ventures AI portfolio and investment amounts
conferenceFindings: CEO Kecia Steelman delivered a keynote at NRF 2026 Big Show in Manhattan (January 2026) titled 'Ulta Beauty Unleashed: Shaping the future of beauty.' In conversation with Deloitte Digital's Bobby Stephens, she discussed how the Ulta Beauty Unleashed strategy has already shown results in her first year as CEO. Key quote: 'It's not just a strategy, it's a way of being and you can feel it through the entire organization.' The session focused on bold vision, strategic innovation, people-forward leadership, and driving profitable growth through personalization and omnichannel expansion.
